author_name_ar: أبو داود سليمان بن الأشعث السِّجِسْتَانِي
author_name_en: Abu Dawud Sulayman ibn al-Ash'ath al-Sijistani
english_translation: Narrated by Bishr ibn Asim al-Thaqafi: [No complete hadith text provided - only companion attribution]

narrators.name: Bishr ibn Asim
narrators.full_name: Bishr ibn Asim ibn Umayyah al-Thaqafi

chainIssues: Mawquf hadith - statement of a companion without chain to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Hadith is mawquf (terminated at companion level)
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be used as direct evidence for statements or actions of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Statement of Companion Bishr ibn Asim

author_name_ar: أبو داود سليمان بن الأشعث السِّجِسْتَانِي
author_name_en: Abu Dawud Sulayman ibn al-Ash'ath al-Sijistani
english_translation: Narrated by Abu Wail from Sayyar from Suwaid ibn Abd al-Aziz: Muhammad ibn Musffa and Mahmud ibn Khalid reported to us from Suwaid ibn Abd al-Aziz, from Sayyar, from Abu Wail, that Umar appointed Bishr ibn Asim over the charitable contributions of Hawazin. Bishr was negligent, so Umar met him and said: 'Do we not have hearing and obedience from you?' He said: 'Yes, but I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: "Whoever is placed in charge of any of the affairs of the Muslims and does not undertake it with sincerity will be brought on the Day of Resurrection hanging over the Bridge of Jahannam, and if he was good he will be saved, and if he was evil he will fall through it for seventy years."' Then Umar left grieving and sad, and Abu Dharr met him and said: 'Why do I see you grieving and sad?' He said: 'What prevents me from being grieving and sad when I heard Bishr ibn Asim say: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: "Whoever is placed in charge of any of the people..." [similar wording]' Abu Dharr said: 'Did you hear it from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ?' He said: 'No.' Abu Dharr said: 'I testify that I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: "Whoever is placed in charge of any of the people will be brought on the Day of Resurrection until he is made to stand over the Bridge of Jahannam..."'

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Musffa
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Musffa al-Basri

narrators.name: Mahmud ibn Khalid
narrators.full_name: Mahmud ibn Khalid al-Thalabi al-Raqqi

narrators.name: Suwaid ibn Abd al-Aziz

Suwaid ibn Abd al-Aziz has reliability concerns (Saduq Yahim)

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Musffa
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Musffa al-Basri

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Second chain through Abu Dharr with direct hearing from Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Suwaid ibn Abd al-Aziz (classified as Saduq Yahim) is in the chain
potential_issues.impact: Suwaid has reliability concerns, though he is generally accepted. The hadith is supported by transmission from Abu Dharr with explicit hearing.

potential_issues.issue: Sayyar ibn Salamah uses indirect transmission term 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Minimal impact as Sayyar is generally considered acceptable and narrates from reliable narrators

IISGrade: Acceptable
Topics: Accountability of rulers on the Day of Judgment
Responsibility of those placed in authority
Incident of Umar and Abu Dharr discussing authority

author_name_ar: أبو داود سليمان بن الأشعث السِّجِسْتَانِي
author_name_en: Abu Dawud Sulayman ibn al-Ash'ath al-Sijistani
english_translation: Narrated by Kardam ibn Sufyan al-Thaqafi: He said to the Prophet ﷺ, 'Which army is equipped with shields?' The Prophet ﷺ recognized that army when Tariq ibn al-Muarraqa' said: 'Who will give me a spear in exchange for the reward thereof?' I said: 'What is its reward?' He said: 'The first daughter born to me I shall marry to him.' I gave him my spear and then I forgot about it for years until I was told that a daughter was born to him and had reached maturity. I said: 'Send her to me,' but he refused unless I gave him a dowry. The Prophet ﷺ asked: 'Which of the women is she?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, she has reached her teens.' He said: 'It is better for you that you do not sin and do not burden your companion with sin.'

potential_issues.issue: Female narrators in the chain (Sarah bint Miksam and Maymunah bint Kardam)
potential_issues.impact: Female narrators are generally acceptable if reliable, and both are classified as Saduq

potential_issues.issue: Maymunah narrates from her father using 'an
potential_issues.impact: This is acceptable given the strong possibility of hearing from her father as a family member

IISGrade: Acceptable
Topics: Incident of Kardam questioning the Prophet ﷺ about a slave woman
Matter of marriage contract and dowry
Guidance on avoiding sin and not burdening others

author_name_ar: أبو داود سليمان بن الأشعث السِّجِسْتَانِي
author_name_en: Abu Dawud Sulayman ibn al-Ash'ath al-Sijistani
english_translation: Narrated by a man from Thaqif called Wahb ibn Abd Allah ibn Qarib (or Marib) from his father: That he heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'May Allah have mercy upon those who shave their heads.' And he extended his hand. A man said: 'And those who shorten (their hair), O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'May Allah have mercy upon those who shave their heads.' The man asked again: 'And those who shorten (their hair), O Messenger of Allah?' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said in the third or fourth (time): 'And those who shorten (their hair).' And he brought his hand close to his chest.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abu Bakr Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah al-Kufi
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.full_name: Sufyan ibn Uyaynah ibn Umayyah al-Hilali
reliabilityIssues: Known for some confusion in later life
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: He narrated to us (direct hearing) - abbreviated form

narrators.name: Wahb ibn Abd Allah ibn Qarib
narrators.full_name: Wahb ibn Abd Allah ibn Qarib al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Father of Wahb
narrators.full_name: Abd Allah ibn Qarib al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Ibrahim ibn Maysarah has weak reliability (La Ba'sa Bihi)
Wahb ibn Abd Allah is Majhul al-Hal (unknown condition)
Both Ibrahim and Wahb use 'an (عَنْ) with indirect transmission

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim ibn Maysarah is classified as La Ba'sa Bihi (weak reliability)
potential_issues.impact: This narrates from a weak narrator, which affects the overall reliability of the chain

potential_issues.issue: Wahb ibn Abd Allah ibn Qarib is Majhul al-Hal (unknown condition)
potential_issues.impact: Little is known about the reliability of this narrator, making the chain weaker

potential_issues.issue: Both Ibrahim and Wahb use indirect transmission term 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Indirect transmission combined with weak narrators further weakens the chain

IISGrade: Weak But Might Be Acceptable
Topics: Mercy upon those who shave their heads in Hajj
Mercy upon those who shorten their hair
Exchange between the Prophet ﷺ and a companion regarding Hajj practices
Description of the Prophet's ﷺ gesture in relation to shaving and shortening hair
